column2: What is the number of steps per revolution of a stepper motor with a stepper angle of 1.8 degrees per step?
What is the pull-out torque?
column4: Pull-out torque refers to the maximum torque that a stepper motor can generate while operating at a given speed before it loses synchronization with the input pulses, causing the motor to ”miss” steps or stall. When the motor’s load exceeds the pull-out torque, it can no longer maintain its designed step angle or speed, resulting in a loss of position accuracy. Pull-out torque decreases as the speed of the  motor increases due to the inherent characteristics of stepper motors.
